body: Fixed mobile layout overflow and soft-wrapping issues on documentation pages by constraining content within a container and improving responsive CSS. Added padding and safe-area support for small screens, prevented grid and media overflow, and ensured long text wraps correctly. Verified locally on a mobile-sized viewport with horizontal scrolling eliminated.

comment_data.body: avoid the `a>b` stylistic changes, so that the PR is more focused.
what is the point of this change
Thanks for the catch — you’re right. This is a stylistic change and not needed for this PR. I’ll revert it to keep the diff focused.

I’ve reverted the change and made the same update for the remaining cases.
Please have another look.

comment_regular_data.body: Thanks. Why is `rendered_build.html` in the commit? Also don't remove the EOL from `static/css/main.css` .

> Thanks. Why is `rendered_build.html` in the commit? Also don't remove the EOL from `static/css/main.css` .

Thanks for pointing this out.

rendered_build.html is a static snapshot of the final HTML generated by Hugo for the /doc/build/ page. I used it locally to inspect the fully rendered output (i.e., the combined result of baseof.html, single.html, and the markdown content) to verify that the .container wrapping was being applied correctly. Since this file is only useful for local debugging and isn’t part of the source workflow, it shouldn’t be included in the commit. I’ll remove it from the PR.

Regarding static/css/main.css, acknowledged. I won’t remove the trailing EOL and will ensure it’s preserved in the next update.

I’ll push a cleaned-up revision shortly.

This slightly increases the space after a list-item bullet: I tried your changes locally, and don't see any other meaningful differences. I tried: - wide screens - very narrow screens - homepage (which has "media") - user docs - `doc/build/` At this point, I'm just going to close this PR. In the future, please provide: - screenshots - clear, concise explanation of what problem this change actually solves - keep the changes as minimal as possible, and well-organized

title: Fix mobile overflow and soft-wrapping issues on documentation pages
